The Beekmantown Central School District recently revised the 2020-2021 school calendar. The purpose for this revision was to provide the school community more time to prepare for a safe and efficient return to a more complex and regulated school year. By adopting a later start date we will be able to provide each department, school, staff and caregiver the gift of time to prepare. During this time we are committed to evaluating other institutions around the area, state and country. We will be able to train our staff more effectively by adding a professional development day to the beginning of the year. We will also review or revise as needed current best practices with the sole intent of keeping everyone safe while providing the best learning environment for staff and students.

Please reference the district website for revised 2020-2021 school calendar:
https://www.bcsdk12.org/apps/pages/index.jsp?uREC_ID=1045860&type=d&pREC_ID=1344722

Dear Beekmantown School Community,

On behalf of the Beekmantown Central School District we want to take a second to thank the community for your continued support over the last few months. Tomorrow we will begin counting our budget votes and the votes cast for school board members. This is a long process as votes cast for each item on the ballot will need careful and complete consideration. To ensure the process is valid, we have secured twenty (20) election inspectors to accurately and timely count each vote until all ballots are processed. Due to the large number of ballots received by mail and the inability to use the electronic voting machines we anticipate the counting process to take a few days. We will announce our outcomes as soon as possible with an estimated date of Tuesday, June 23, 2020. We appreciate your patience as we take the time necessary to ensure each vote is counted correctly.

Beekmantown will honor the Class of 2020 by lighting up the new athletic facility on June 2, 2020 at 8:20pm (2020 military time). This display is not meant to encourage gatherings, students and community members are encouraged to drive by the field, honking your horns is encouraged, but parking in the school parking lots and along the road is strictly prohibited.

The Beekmantown Central School District is extremely proud of the Class of 2020! Your accomplishments are greatly commended! We look forward to seeing you drive by on June 2nd!

Eagle Pride means caring about the health and safety of all of our neighbors in the community. We take pride in our district's efforts to reduce the spread of the COVID-19. As we enter Memorial Day weekend, take pride in knowing that there are actions that YOU can do to keep this virus at bay - the easiest way to show your Eagle Pride is by wearing a mask.

My mask protects YOU. Your mask protects Me.

Even if you don't have symptoms, wearing masks in public is important to reduce the possible spread of the COVID-19 virus.

WITHOUT A MASK:
• Your cough or sneeze travels a LOT farther.
• More germs are released into the air and onto surfaces.
• More people can get sick from your germs.

WITH A FABRIC MASK:
• Your cough or sneeze is more contained.
• Fewer germs are released.
• More people are protected from your germs.

#BCSDEaglePride
(Thank you to 7th grader Kat Jewell for the custom logo)

Beekmantown VOL. FIRE DEPT.

West Chazy Vol. Fire Department
Peru Fire Department
Keeseville Volunteer Fire Department

Please donate if you are able to help this important cause and to honor those who served our country.

Currently, 52.9% of New Yorkers have completed their 2020 Census from home via the web, phone or mail, which ranks New York 41st in the nation for response rate. In Clinton County our response rate is only a few percentage points higher at 56.1%! We can and must do something to increase this rate. The results of the 2020 Census will determine how billions of federal dollars are allocated including aid to school districts. Ensuring a complete count in our communities is essential to securing crucial federal funding for New York State and for our district. If you haven't replied yet, PLEASE go to: https://2020census.gov/ It takes under 10 minutes to do and will have an impact for years to come. If you can, please also share this post with friends and family. Thank you.

Yesterday Superintendent Daniel W. Mannix along with several students brought 100 face shields to CVPH Hospital. These units were 3D printed and assembled by a variety or Beekmantown CSD staff and students along with many local community members. This delivery and our district's efforts have greatly improved the hospital's ability to acquire high quality PPE (personal protective equipment).

This 3D printing equipment, normally used in an academic setting, is now being leveraged to help our frontline health care heros protect themselves from potential infections. Many thanks to our community for helping our district acquire these resources and to our staff, students and members from surrounding communities for all of their tireless efforts.

This 3D printing equipment, normally used in an academic setting, is now being leveraged to help our frontline health care heros protect themselves from potential infections. Also linked below is a folder of the many steps in the process of creating this protective equipment. Many thanks to our community for helping our district acquire these resources and to our staff, students and members from surrounding communities for all of their tireless efforts.

Dear Parent/Guardian:
The New York State Education department now requires that school districts perform four Emergency LockdownDrills per year. In order to ensure that staff and students are truly prepared should an emergency arise, we are currently conducting a PLANNED emergency lockdown DRILL at the Beekmantown Elementary, Middle and High schools. The purpose of this DRILL is to ensure that in the event of a dangerous situation in the building, staff and students know what to do.
We appreciate your cooperation with this DRILL. Our number one priority is the safety of all of our students. If you would like more information about requirements for schools for safety drills, http://www.p12.nysed.gov/sss/documents/NewSafetyLegis_FieldMemoFINAL.pdf
If you have any questions regarding our safety drills going forward, do not hesitate to reach out to your child's building principal at their school's main office. Thank you for helping us to create a safe learning environment for your child here at Beekmantown.

Yesterday and today, four Beekmantown FFA members attended the NYS FFA’s State Leaders Experience conference in Albany. Yesterday these students got to tour the Capital, Corning Tower and attend leadership workshops to prepare them for their many legislative visits today.

Bryce Berry, Samantha Parker, Nicole Jones and Zachary LaBombard all sat down and talked the importance of Agriculture Education and FFA being not only in our school but other schools across our region. It is experiences such as this one that open the door for many career opportunities for our students.

Highlights of the trip were meeting with Assemblyman Billy Jones, Senator Betty Little as well as the Deputy Secretary of Agriculture, Patrick Hooker!

We look forward to many future visits to Albany to lobby for Agriculture Education! #EaglePride #BeekmantownFFA #AgricultureEducation
